channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Human Motion Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Motion Diffusion Model (MDM), a carefully adapted classifier-free diffusion-based generative model for the human motion domain.

item.title: NerfAcc: A General NeRF Acceleration Toolbox
item.description: We propose NerfAcc, a toolbox for efficient volumetric rendering of radiance fields.

item.title: VToonify: Controllable High-Resolution Portrait Video Style Transfer
item.description: Although a series of successful portrait image toonification models built upon the powerful StyleGAN have been proposed, these image-oriented methods have obvious limitations when applied to videos, such as the fixed frame size, the requirement of face alignment, missing non-facial details and temporal inconsistency.

item.title: Ask Me Anything: A simple strategy for prompting language models
item.description: Prompting is a brittle process wherein small modifications to the prompt can cause large variations in the model predictions, and therefore significant effort is dedicated towards designing a painstakingly "perfect prompt" for a task.

item.title: Content-Based Search for Deep Generative Models
item.description: The growing proliferation of pretrained generative models has made it infeasible for a user to be fully cognizant of every model in existence.

item.title: DigiFace-1M: 1 Million Digital Face Images for Face Recognition
item.description: Such models are trained on large-scale datasets that contain millions of real human face images collected from the internet.

item.title: Shape, Light, and Material Decomposition from Images using Monte Carlo Rendering and Denoising
item.description: Unfortunately, Monte Carlo integration provides estimates with significant noise, even at large sample counts, which makes gradient-based inverse rendering very challenging.

item.title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: By decomposing the image formation process into a sequential application of denoising autoencoders, diffusion models (DMs) achieve state-of-the-art synthesis results on image data and beyond.

item.title: An Efficient Person Clustering Algorithm for Open Checkout-free Groceries
item.description: Then, to ensure that the method adapts to the dynamic and unseen person flow, we propose Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) with a simple Nearest Neighbor (NN) strategy to accurately cluster the instances of CSG.

item.title: clip2latent: Text driven sampling of a pre-trained StyleGAN using denoising diffusion and CLIP
item.description: We introduce a new method to efficiently create text-to-image models from a pre-trained CLIP and StyleGAN.

item.title: DreamBooth: Fine Tuning Text-to-Image Diffusion Models for Subject-Driven Generation
item.description: Once the subject is embedded in the output domain of the model, the unique identifier can then be used to synthesize fully-novel photorealistic images of the subject contextualized in different scenes.

item.title: Min-Max Similarity: A Contrastive Semi-Supervised Deep Learning Network for Surgical Tools Segmentation
item.description: To address this issue, we proposed a semi-supervised segmentation network based on contrastive learning.

item.title: DINO: DETR with Improved DeNoising Anchor Boxes for End-to-End Object Detection
item.description: Compared to other models on the leaderboard, DINO significantly reduces its model size and pre-training data size while achieving better results.

item.title: Improved Training of Wasserstein GANs
item.description: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are powerful generative models, but suffer from training instability.

item.title: Wasserstein GAN
item.description: We introduce a new algorithm named WGAN, an alternative to traditional GAN training.

item.title: Generating Multi-Categorical Samples with Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: We propose a method to train generative adversarial networks on mutivariate feature vectors representing multiple categorical values.

item.title: TEACH: Temporal Action Composition for 3D Humans
item.description: In particular, our goal is to enable the synthesis of a series of actions, which we refer to as temporal action composition.

item.title: Automatic Chain of Thought Prompting in Large Language Models
item.description: Providing these steps for prompting demonstrations is called chain-of-thought (CoT) prompting.

item.title: Time Will Tell: New Outlooks and A Baseline for Temporal Multi-View 3D Object Detection
item.description: While recent camera-only 3D detection methods leverage multiple timesteps, the limited history they use significantly hampers the extent to which temporal fusion can improve object perception.

item.title: GET3D: A Generative Model of High Quality 3D Textured Shapes Learned from Images
item.description: As several industries are moving towards modeling massive 3D virtual worlds, the need for content creation tools that can scale in terms of the quantity, quality, and diversity of 3D content is becoming evident.
